api.ai.title: AI Integration Prompt
api.ai.desc: Copy the prompt below to ChatGPT, Claude, or Cursor to let AI write the integration code for you.
api.ai.prompt_template:
Hello, I am developing a project and need to integrate QingChen Mail email sending API. Please write a working integration code based on the following complete API documentation. ============================================================ üìã 1. API Overview ============================================================ | Item | Value | |------------|---------------------------------------| | System | QingChen Mail | | Base URL | {base_url} | | Auth | Bearer Token (API Key) | | Content | application/json | | Encoding | UTF-8 | Common Headers: Authorization: Bearer sk_live_xxxxxxxxxxxxxx Content-Type: application/json ============================================================ üì§ 2. Send Email API ============================================================ POST /send [Request Body (JSON)] | Field | Type | Req. | Description | |--------------|---------|------|----------------------------------------------------|| | to | String | Yes | Recipient email address | | subject | String | Cond | Email subject (optional if template_id is used) | | body | String | Cond | Email body HTML (optional if template_id is used) | | from | String | No | Sender address (default: noreply@domain) | | template_id | Integer | No | Template ID, overrides subject/body if provided | | variables | Object | No | Template variables for {{.key}} placeholder | | channel_id | Integer | No | SMTP channel ID. 0=auto routing, >0=specific | | attachments | Array | No | Attachment list, each with filename + content/url | Attachment object (attachments[]): | Field | Type | Description | |--------------|--------|---------------------------------------------| | filename | String | File name (e.g. "report.pdf") | | content | String | Base64-encoded file content (or use url) | | url | String | Remote file URL (or use content) | | content_type | String | MIME type (e.g. "application/pdf"), optional | ‚ö†Ô∏è Limits: Max 10MB per attachment. Internal/private URLs are blocked (SSRF protection). [Success Response] HTTP 202 Accepted { "message": "Email queued successfully", "queue_id": 1024 } Note: Emails are sent asynchronously. queue_id is the task ID. HTTP 202 means accepted into queue. Check delivery status via logs API. [Error Response Format] { "error": "Error description message" } [HTTP Status Codes] | Code | Meaning | |------|------------------------------------------| | 202 | Email successfully queued for sending | | 400 | Bad request (missing fields, etc.) | | 401 | Authentication failed (invalid token/key)| | 403 | API Key lacks permission for endpoint | | 429 | Rate limit exceeded (slow down) | | 500 | Internal server error | API Key Permissions: API Keys (sk_live_) can only access: - POST /send (Send email) - GET /stats (Get statistics) - GET/POST/DELETE /files (File management) Other admin endpoints require JWT Token (via login). ============================================================ üìä 3. Statistics API ============================================================ GET /stats [Success Response] HTTP 200 { "total_sent": 1234, "today_sent": 56, "success_count": 1200, "failure_count": 34, "last_sent_time": "2026-02-06T12:00:00Z", "trend": [ { "time": "08:00", "count": 10 }, { "time": "09:00", "count": 25 } ] } ============================================================ üìã 4. Logs API ============================================================ GET /logs?page=1&page_size=50&status=success&search=keyword [Query Parameters] | Param | Type | Description | |-----------|--------|----------------------------------| | page | Int | Page number, default 1 | | page_size | Int | Items per page, default 50 max 200| | status | String | Filter by: success / failed | | search | String | Search recipient or subject | [Success Response] HTTP 200 { "data": [ { "id": 1, "recipient": "user@example.com", "subject": "Test Email", "status": "success", "channel": "smtp_1", "tracking_id": "abc123", "opened": true, "clicked_count": 3, "created_at": "2026-02-06T12:00:00Z" } ], "total": 1234, "page": 1, "page_size": 50 } ============================================================ üì¨ 5. Template Management API ============================================================ GET /templates -- List all templates POST /templates -- Create template PUT /templates/:id -- Update template DELETE /templates/:id -- Delete template Create/Update body: { "name": "Verification Code", "subject": "Your code: {{.code}}", "body": "

Code: {{.code}}

Valid for 5 minutes

" } Template syntax: Go template {{.variableName}}. Pass corresponding key-value pairs in the variables field when sending. ============================================================ üë• 6. Contact Management API ============================================================ GET /contacts/groups -- List contact groups POST /contacts/groups -- Create group GET /contacts?page=1&page_size=50 -- List contacts POST /contacts -- Add contact PUT /contacts/:id -- Update contact DELETE /contacts/:id -- Delete contact POST /contacts/import -- Bulk import GET /contacts/export -- Export contacts Add contact body: { "email": "user@example.com", "name": "John Doe", "group_id": 1 } Bulk import body: { "group_id": 1, "data": "user1@test.com,User1\nuser2@test.com,User2" } ============================================================ üîë 7. API Key Management ============================================================ GET /keys -- List all API Keys POST /keys -- Create Key {"name": "My Key"} DELETE /keys/:id -- Delete Key Create response: { "id": 1, "name": "My Key", "key": "sk_live_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "created_at": "2026-02-06T12:00:00Z" } ‚ö†Ô∏è The full key is only shown once at creation time. Save it securely. ============================================================ üîß 8. Error Handling Best Practices ============================================================ 1. Check HTTP status: 202=queued, 4xx=client error, 5xx=server error 2. Parse the "error" field for specific error messages 3. Implement exponential backoff retry for 429 (max 60s interval) 4. Check API Key validity on 401 errors 5. Recommended timeout: 30 seconds Common errors: 401: {"error": "Unauthorized"} -- Token/Key missing or invalid 401: {"error": "Invalid token or API key"} -- Token expired or Key deleted 403: {"error": "API Key does not have permission to access this endpoint"} 400: {"error": "Template not found"} -- Invalid template_id 400: {"error": "Attachment xxx exceeds limit (10MB)"} 429: {"error": "Too many requests, please try again later"} 500: {"error": "Failed to queue email: ..."} -- Internal error ============================================================ üìù 9. Complete Examples ============================================================ Example 1: Basic send curl -X POST {base_url}/send \ -H "Authorization: Bearer sk_live_xxx" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{"to":"test@example.com","subject":"Hello","body":"

Hi!

"}' Response: HTTP 202 {"message":"Email queued successfully","queue_id":1} Example 2: Template + Variables curl -X POST {base_url}/send \ -H "Authorization: Bearer sk_live_xxx" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{"to":"test@example.com","template_id":1,"variables":{"name":"John","code":"8848"}}' Example 3: With attachment (remote URL) curl -X POST {base_url}/send \ -H "Authorization: Bearer sk_live_xxx" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{"to":"test@example.com","subject":"Invoice","body":"Please see attached","attachments":[{"filename":"invoice.pdf","url":"https://oss.example.com/inv.pdf","content_type":"application/pdf"}]}' ============================================================ [Code Requirements] 1. Write in [Python/Java/Node.js/PHP/Go/C#] language. 2. Create a reusable client class/module with send_email(), get_stats(), get_logs() methods. 3. Properly handle all HTTP status codes (202/400/401/403/429/500). 4. Implement automatic retry with exponential backoff for 429. 5. If attachments contain local file paths, auto-read and convert to Base64. 6. Provide complete usage examples and error handling examples.

api.send.title: Send Email API
api.param.subject: Email Subject
api.param.body: Email body (HTML). Required if template_id is not provided.
api.param.template_id: Use Template ID. Overrides subject/body if provided, supports variable substitution.
api.param.channel_id: SMTP Channel ID (0 or empty for Auto Routing, >0 for specific SMTP config ID)
api.param.attachments: Attachment List. Supports content (Base64) or url (Remote URL). Max 10MB each.
